meanings.definition: Measure or determine the amount of something again.
meanings.sent1: He had to regauged the ingredients for the recipe after realizing he had used the wrong measuring cup.
meanings.sent2: The engineer regauged the fuel levels in the tank to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The baker regauged the flour for the third time, hoping to finally get the perfect consistency.
meanings.sent4: She regauged her progress on the project, realizing she was further behind than she thought.
meanings.sent5: The scientist regauged the data points meticulously to avoid any errors in the analysis.

meanings.definition: Adjust or calibrate a measuring instrument again.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic regauged the pressure gauge on the machine to prevent any malfunctions.
meanings.sent2: After the power outage, the technician regauged the voltage meter to ensure accurate readings.
meanings.sent3: The watchmaker regauged the antique clock, making sure it would keep perfect time.
meanings.sent4: The musician regauged the guitar strings, tuning them to perfection for the concert.
meanings.sent5: The teacher regauged the students' understanding of the lesson by asking them to explain it in their own words.
